Drone Tempur Siluman XQ-58 AS Rusak dalam Uji Coba
05 Nov 2019, 07:01 by Tempo.co, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Drone tempur siluman yang sedang dikembangkan Angkatan Udara Amerika Serikat, Kratos XQ-58 Valkyrie, mengalami sejumlah kerusakan saat gagal mendarat dengan mulus dalam uji coba ketiga, 9 Oktober 2019.
Menurut rilis Angkatan Udara AS, yang dikutip laman The Drive, drone baru saja menyelesaikan penerbangan ketiganya ketika terjadi insiden. Namun Low Cost Attritable Strike Demonstrator (LCASD), yang menangani proyek ini, menyatakan uji coba berhasil.
Kecelakaan itu terjadi pada 9 Oktober 2019, setelah XQ-58A mendarat di Yuma Proving Ground di Arizona. "Angin permukaan yang tinggi dan kerusakan pada sistem pemulihan uji penerbangan sementara kendaraan menghasilkan kecelakaan," menurut siaran pers resmi Angkatan Udara.
"Sistem bantal prototipe, yang digunakan untuk seri uji awal tetapi tidak dimaksudkan untuk penggunaan operasional utama, mengalami anomali yang mengakibatkan pesawat mengalami kerusakan pada saat mendarat," kata juru bicara Kratos, menjelaskan dalam pernyataan resminya.
â€œKami terus mempelajari pesawat ini dan potensi teknologi yang dapat ditawarkan sebagai pesawat tempur. Penerbangan ketiga ini berhasil menyelesaikan tujuannya dan melengkapi dua penerbangan pertama," kata perwira tinggi Angkatan Udara AS William Cooley, kepala Laboratorium Penelitian Angkatan Udara (AFRL), yang menjalankan program LCASD.
Kratos XQ-58 Valkyrie adalah pesawat tempur tak berawak yang dirancang dan dibangun oleh Kratos untuk Angkatan Udara Amerika Serikat. Valkyrie berhasil menyelesaikan penerbangan pertamanya pada 5 Maret 2019 di Yuma Proving Ground, Arizona.
XQ-58 Valkyrie termasuk dalam portofolio Teknologi Pesawat Attritable Biaya Rendah (LCAAT). Peran LCAAT adalah untuk mengawal F-22 atau F-35 selama misi tempur, dan untuk dapat menggunakan senjata atau sistem pengintaian.
Drone siluman ini mempunyai panjang 8,8 meter, bentang sayap 6,7 meter, kecepatan maksimal 1.050 km perjam, jangkauan 3.941 km, dan makimal ketinggian 13 ribu meter. Pesawat dirancang bisa membawa 8 rudal dengan berat 250 kg.
XQ-58 dirancang sebagai 'wingman loyal' yang dikendalikan oleh pesawat induk untuk menyelesaikan tugas-tugas seperti memandu atau menyerap tembakan musuh jika diserang.

US XQ-58 Stealth Combat Drone Damaged in Trial
05 Nov 2019, 07:01 by Tempo.co, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The stealth fighter drone that is being developed by the US Air Force, Kratos XQ-58 Valkyrie, suffered a number of damages when it failed to land smoothly in the third trial, 9 October 2019.
According to a US Air Force release, quoted by The Drive page, the drone had just completed its third flight when an incident occurred. But the Low Cost Attritable Strike Demonstrator (LCASD), which handled the project, said the trial was successful.
The accident occurred on October 9, 2019, after the XQ-58A landed at the Yuma Proving Ground in Arizona. "High surface winds and damage to the flight test recovery system while vehicles produce accidents," according to the official Air Force press release.
"The prototype pillow system, which was used for the initial test series but was not intended for primary operational use, experienced an anomaly that caused the aircraft to crash during landing," a Kratos spokesman said, explaining in his official statement.
"We are continuing to study this aircraft and the potential technology that can be offered as a fighter. This third flight successfully completed its objectives and completed the first two flights, "said US Air Force high officer William Cooley, head of the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL), which runs the LCASD program.
The Kratos XQ-58 Valkyrie is an unmanned combat aircraft designed and built by Kratos for the United States Air Force. Valkyrie successfully completed its first flight on March 5, 2019 at Yuma Proving Ground, Arizona.
Valkyrie XQ-58 is included in the Low Cost Attritable Aircraft Technology (LCAAT) portfolio. The role of the LCAAT is to escort F-22 or F-35 during combat missions, and to be able to use weapons or reconnaissance systems.
This stealth drone has a length of 8.8 meters, a wingspan of 6.7 meters, a maximum speed of 1,050 km per hour, a range of 3,941 km, and a maximum height of 13 thousand meters. The aircraft is designed to carry 8 missiles weighing 250 kg.
XQ-58 is designed as a 'loyal wingman' which is controlled by aircraft carriers to complete tasks such as guiding or absorbing enemy fire if attacked.
